Oil slightly dark; Battery terminals have minor corrosion

Generator is in good operational condition. Load test passed successfully. Oil level adequate but color indicates it's nearing change interval. Battery voltage at 12.6V which is acceptable. No fuel leaks detected. Exhaust smoke is normal. Generator has been well-maintained overall.
Oil change - ₦15,000; Battery terminal cleaning - ₦5,000

Unit 3 in main ward making rattling noise; Unit 5 in reception cooling inadequately; Filters in 4 units are dirty

Out of 8 AC units, 6 are functioning well. Unit 3 requires urgent attention as the noise suggests a loose component or failing bearing. Unit 5 is not cooling to desired temperature (currently 26°C instead of 20°C). All filters were inspected and 4 need immediate cleaning or replacement.
Service Unit 3 - ₦30,000; Gas refill Unit 5 - ₦20,000; Clean/replace 4 filters - ₦20,000 (₦5,000 each)

Small leak in staff toilet tap causing water wastage estimated at 20 liters per day.

Plumbing system requires attention in multiple areas. Ward B toilet has weak flush indicating possible valve or water pressure issue. Laboratory sink drains slowly suggesting partial blockage. Cleaning room drain emits sewage odor indicating possible trap issue or main line problem. Two toilets continuously running causing significant water waste (estimated 500 liters per day combined).

Cedar Crest Hospital maintains their facility well overall. The most urgent priority is addressing fire safety compliance issues. Water wastage from plumbing issues represents ongoing unnecessary expense. With the recommended repairs, the facility health score could improve from current 76/100 to projected 85-90/100 within 30 days. Management shows commitment to maintenance and should see good ROI on recommended investments.
